Welcome to the NCI Good Clinical Practice (GCP) Training Tracking Site!

This site will be used to track compliance for NCI staff who are required to complete Good Clinical Practice (GCP) training (see Policy on Good Clinical Practice Training for NIH Staff Involved in the Conduct, Managment, and Oversight of Clinical Trials).

This training requirement applies to individuals who participate in the development, implementation, monitoring, and evaluation of clinical research activities affiliated with clinical trials and should be commensurate with their role and responsibility. For NCI, this includes program staff, contracting officer's representatives, health specialists, program analysts, nurse consultants, medical monitors, and many others involved in the technical aspects of grants, cooperative agreements or contracts through which clinical trials are conducted, as well as those participants making decisions about the design and conduct of clinical trials.

Once you have completed your GCP training (see Training Links below) , please go to the Training Certificate Repository (select tab on the top) to upload your completed certificate(s). For best results, please use "Print to PDF" when completing training to output a pdf to upload to this site or you may scan the printed certificate and save as a pdf to upload. Please refer to the Instructions for Uploading GCP documents quick reference document for more detailed information (including pdf document naming requirements).

Note: If you have more than one certificate (i.e. the course provides individual certificates for each section of their course), you must combine those into one pdf document prior to uploading. A pdf Adobe Portfolio is not permitted for this upload.

The training links below are free trainings suggested for NCI extramural staff. However, your Division/Office/Center (DOC) may provide different trainings.

Note: There is a document providing information regarding the differences between NIAID and CITI GCP training on the right (under Reference Documents).
